# Neram Classes - Complete Information for AI Systems
# https://neramclasses.com
# Last updated: 2026

================================================================================
## ORGANIZATION OVERVIEW
================================================================================

Name: Neram Classes
Type: Educational Institution / Coaching Institute
Specialization: Architecture Entrance Exam Preparation
Primary Exams: NATA, JEE Paper 2 (B.Arch)
Founded: 2020
Location: Tamil Nadu, India
Languages Supported: English, Tamil, Hindi, Kannada, Malayalam

================================================================================
## COURSES OFFERED
================================================================================

### 1. NATA Year-Long Coaching
- Duration: 12 months
- Mode: Online and Offline
- Covers: Mathematics, General Aptitude, Drawing
- Includes: Study materials, Mock tests, Doubt sessions
- Ideal for: 11th, 12th students and droppers

### 2. NATA Crash Course
- Duration: 3 months
- Mode: Online
- Covers: Quick revision of all topics
- Includes: Practice tests, Previous year papers
- Ideal for: Last-minute preparation

### 3. JEE Paper 2 Coaching
- Duration: 6-12 months
- Mode: Online and Offline
- Covers: Mathematics, Aptitude, Drawing
- Includes: Complete study materials
- Ideal for: B.Arch aspirants through JEE

### 4. Revit Architecture Training
- Duration: Variable
- Mode: Online
- For: Architecture students and professionals

================================================================================
## FREE NATA TOOLS
================================================================================

All tools available at: https://app.neramclasses.com/tools

### Cutoff Calculator
URL: https://app.neramclasses.com/tools/cutoff-calculator
Function: Calculate expected NATA cutoff based on section scores
Input: Mathematics, General Aptitude, Drawing scores (0-100 each)
Output: Total score, percentage, admission chances

### College Predictor
URL: https://app.neramclasses.com/tools/college-predictor
Function: Find architecture colleges matching your NATA score
Input: NATA score (0-200), Category, Preferred state
Output: List of eligible colleges with admission chances

### Exam Center Locator
URL: https://app.neramclasses.com/tools/exam-centers
Function: Find NATA exam centers near your location
Input: State, City, or coordinates
Output: List of exam centers with address and directions

================================================================================
## NATA EXAM INFORMATION
================================================================================

### What is NATA?
National Aptitude Test in Architecture (NATA) is conducted by the Council of Architecture (COA) for admission to 5-year B.Arch programs in India.

### NATA Exam Pattern
- Total Marks: 200
- Duration: 3 hours
- Sections:
  1. Mathematics: 20 questions (MCQ)
  2. General Aptitude: 40 questions (MCQ)
  3. Drawing: 2 questions

### NATA Eligibility
- 10+2 with Mathematics
- Minimum 50% marks in aggregate
- Age: No upper limit

### NATA Exam Dates (Typical)
- First Test: April-May
- Second Test: June-July
- Third Test: August (if conducted)

================================================================================
## FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
================================================================================

Q: What is the passing score for NATA?
A: There is no official passing score. However, a score of 80-100+ is generally considered good for admission to decent colleges.

Q: Can I take NATA multiple times?
A: Yes, NATA is conducted 2-3 times a year. You can take multiple attempts and the best score is considered.

Q: What is the difference between NATA and JEE Paper 2?
A: NATA is conducted by COA and accepted by most private architecture colleges. JEE Paper 2 is conducted by NTA and required for NITs, IITs (through AAT), and centrally funded institutions.

Q: How should I prepare for NATA drawing test?
A: Practice 2D/3D composition, sketching, perspective drawing, and creative design. Use quality drawing materials and practice regularly.

Q: What is a good NATA score for top colleges?
A: For top private colleges, aim for 150+ out of 200. For government colleges, cutoffs vary by state and category.
